snippet: Nassau County officials are calling for a deeper investigation of an arrest of a man who had collected signatures for a third-party candidate for county executive. The police commissioner resigned and the chief of detectives retired on Thursday.
abstract: Nassau County officials are calling for investigation of unusually aggressive and public arrest of Randy White for unpaid $250 fine as result of misdemeanor charges for selling bootleg DVDs; some officials suspect that arrest of White, who collected third-party candidate for county executive, is politically motivated; investigation has already led to resignation of county police commissioner, Thomas V Dale.
lead_paragraph: Nassau County officials are calling for a deeper investigation of an arrest of a man who had collected signatures for a third-party candidate for county executive. The police commissioner resigned and the chief of detectives retired on Thursday.

headline.main: A Seemingly Routine Arrest, Fraught With County Politics
headline.print_headline: A Seemingly Routine Arrest, Fraught With County Politics
